thread.title: Benjamin Netanyahu Gets a Warm Reception From Australia’s Leader - The New York Times
thread.title_full: Benjamin Netanyahu Gets a Warm Reception From Australia’s Leader - The New York Times

author: Jacqueline Williams
title: Benjamin Netanyahu Gets a Warm Reception From Australia’s Leader - The New York Times
text:
By JACQUELINE WILLIAMS and GERRY MULLANY FEB. 22, 2017 Continue reading the main story Photo Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel, left, with his host, Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull, in Sydney, Australia, on Wednesday. The visit was a first by a sitting Israeli leader. Credit Jason Reed/Reuters SYDNEY, Australia — Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel was warmly welcomed here Wednesday by his Australian counterpart, Malcolm Turnbull, with the Israeli leader promoting the two countries’ growing ties as Israel faces rising international criticism over its settlement policy in the West Bank. “I’m honored to be the first Israeli prime minister to officially visit Australia ,” Mr. Netanyahu said at a joint news conference. “It’s been a long time coming. It celebrates, really, a hundred years of friendship of Australia to the Jewish people and their state.” Mr. Netanyahu’s visit has generated some pushback here , with 60 notable Australians having signed a letter opposing it because of Israel’s policies toward the Palestinians . Australia was one of a handful of countries to speak out against a United Nations Security Council resolution critical of recent moves to expand Israeli settlements in the West Bank and East Jerusalem. Australia called the resolution “one sided” and “deeply unsettling.” Mr. Netanyahu praised Australia for pointing out what he called the hypocrisy of the United Nations. “Australia’s been courageously willing to puncture U.N. hypocrisy, more than once,” he said. 
Advertisement Mr. Turnbull said that on the general question of a two-state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict — a goal that President Trump recently seemed to call into question — Australia’s position had not changed.
